summary: SummaryMario Badescu's Cleansing Oil is a nourishing oil cleanser that doubles as makeup remover. Melts away makeup and cleanses skin without leaving a greasy, slick film.
details: DetailsBenefitsNourishing 2-in-1 formula gently cleanses while removing makeup and impurities effortlessly, including hard to remove eye makeupThis light and smooth oil never feels heavy or greasy on skinFormulated with Evening Primrose Oil for enhanced moistureFormulated WithoutMineral oilParabensDye'sPhthalatesSulfatesFragranceAlcoholSiliconeItem 2580420How To UseTo use as a makeup remover, deposit 1-2 pumps onto a cloth or cotton pad and glide across face. Close eyes and swipe in a gentle downward motion to remove face and eye makeup. To use as a cleanser, deposit 1-2 pumps directly with fingertips and massage onto dry skin. Dampen your hands with warm water and massage onto face to emulsify the oil into a light, milky texture. For use morning and night. If product gets into eyes, rinse well with water.IngredientsCetyl Ethylhexanoate, Polyglyceryl-10 Dioleate, Isononyl Isononanoate, Polyglyceryl-10 Oleate, Pentaerythrityl Tetraethylhexanoate, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Oryza Sativa (Rice) Bran Oil, Polyglyceryl-2 Oleate, Phenoxyethanol, Aqua (Water, Eau), Oenothera Biennis (Evening Primrose) Oil, Simmondsia Chinensis (Jojoba) Seed Oil, Chlorphenesin, Caprylyl Glycol, Lavandula Hybrida OilShipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: To use as a makeup remover, deposit 1-2 pumps onto a cloth or cotton pad and glide across face. Close eyes and swipe in a gentle downward motion to remove face and eye makeup. To use as a cleanser, deposit 1-2 pumps directly with fingertips and massage onto dry skin. Dampen your hands with warm water and massage onto face to emulsify the oil into a light, milky texture. For use morning and night. If product gets into eyes, rinse well with water.

reviews.headline: I have to be honest this is the LAST Mario in the store
reviews.comments: Again with Mario,The LAST in the store where can I purchase Mario ? phasng out

reviews.headline: The Best
reviews.comments: I absolutely love the feel of this oil! It does what I need it to do in removing my makeup. Its silky on my face and comes off easily.

reviews.headline: Best Oil Cleanser
reviews.comments: You MUST use on dry skin firstâ€¦ it will break down all your makeup and spf. I usually rub it around for a good 45 seconds or more. Then you add your water and keep washing. It emulsifies and rinses right off. I think those who are complaining about it's efficacy or leaving a residue are probably not using it correctly.

reviews.headline: My Favorite
reviews.comments: Its is light and fragrance free.  Exactly what i wanted.  Feels silky and smooth.

reviews.headline: Awesome face oil
reviews.comments: Dry, and that is perfect for me. I love it.

reviews.headline: Great for quick cleanse or double cleansing
reviews.comments: On my second bottle â€” perfect for breaking down makeup (lipstain, mascara, you name it) or a quick cleanse. Smell is spa-like and enjoyable. Cannot beat the price point.

reviews.headline: I Love This!
reviews.comments: Im not sure how this has so many bad reviewsâ€¦ I love this oil & ive tried several!! this is my favorite. It works great for removing my light coverage makeup & then I follow up with another cleanser.

reviews.headline: Love it, but not for makeup removal
reviews.comments:
This is advertised for makeup removal, but a double cleanse, balm, or makeup wipe works 10x betterâ€¦ this product is great for a morning face wash, when you just want a gentle cleanse that doesn't leave your face feeling dry, or stripped of its natural oils for the rest of the day, following with just a  
moisturizer or makeup.

reviews.headline: Love this !
reviews.comments: Best cleansing oil (same as another brand that I like that is twice the price!) takes off all my makeup , including waterproof mascara. does not irritate my eyes. i hope they always make this stuff!!

reviews.headline: Terrible
reviews.comments: Terrible smell and consistency. Ive used it a handful of times and Ill be throwing the full bottle away it was that bad.

reviews.headline: This stuff is awful
reviews.comments: Doesnt get everything off, mascara stags put and leaves a ridiculously greasy residue

reviews.headline: FAVORITE CLEANSING OIL!
reviews.comments: I have used the method of cleansing oils for years. This is by far the best & most affordable one I've come across. It leaves no residue on skin after rinsing with water and more importantly doesn't irritate eyes. My skin feels clean, brighter as well balanced.

reviews.headline: Oh its an Oil barrier alright
reviews.comments: It does not emulsify or foam... nope... the oil barrier it created was so thick that it clumped on my hands. It's an OK eye makeup remover but I had to use ANOTHER cleanser JUST TO GET IT OFF MY FACE AND HANDS... oh and then it slimed my shower floor and I slipped in it. Straight back to returns. Going back to my Ordinary Squaline cleanser... this is a safe ty hazard

reviews.headline: Not for me!
reviews.comments: As a makeup remover, it burned my eyes so bad and the pain lasted like a day. It also caused me to get a stye. I also tried it as an oil cleanser and it caused me to have a severe breakout. I never really struggle with acne so just be careful if you have acne prone skin. Only used it a handful of times, so never again!

reviews.headline: works wonders
reviews.comments: The reviews don't give this enough credit. I'm a makeup artist who wears layers and layers of makeup and this takes EVERYTHING off. I've tried just about every cleansing oil/balm on the market and this is my fave so far. As long as you use this on DRY skin, rinse, then follow with a water based cleanser; this will take off all your waterproof makeup and sunscreen quickly. No complaints.

reviews.headline: Leaves residue
reviews.comments: I feel as though this product is great but misses the mark for its sole purpose. You can't properly wash it off and it can lead to breakouts.

reviews.headline: yes yes YES
reviews.comments: FEELS AMAZING ON MY SKIN I WILL ALWAYS RECOMMEND THIS TO ANYBODY!!!

reviews.headline: Great Cleanser
reviews.comments: I've used this cleanser since it came out. It dissolves mascara quickly, as well as any other makeup I have on. You can use this alone or follow up with another cleanser if you wear a lot of makeup. I've used MB products for 20 years and they have been the best for my skin ðŸ’š

reviews.headline: Doesn't breakdown makeup
reviews.comments: Barely breaks down makeup, especially mascara. It is very scented.

reviews.headline: Favorite cleanser right now
reviews.comments: I have dry, sensitive, reactive skin. This cleanser has been my favorite the past few months. I was having a hard time finding a cleanser that didn't leave a white film on my face and washed all of my sunscreen off. Mario Badescu Cleansing Oil does a much better job than the cream cleanser I had been using and I haven't noticed any irritation from it, which is very rare for me lately. It works best if you rub it between your hands a bit before applying to a damp face.

faceoff_positive.comments:
Unless you have very dry skin, you should use this as a double/pre-cleanse. I have combination/sensitive skin with pore congestion on/around my nose. I use this as a pre-cleanse to help remove the top layer of my daily grime/oil before using my cleanser. 

I leave this cleansing oil on for 3-5 minutes to let it really work and rinse with lukewarm water. I follow with my preferred cleanser and a generous spritz of the Mario Badescu Facial Spray with Aloe, Adaptogens, and Coconut Water.

I think a lot of individuals expect things to work immediately. Yet it takes time for skin to adjust to products, depending. Everyone's skin is different and the same product is not going to work for everyone. It isn't necessarily a "bad product" if it doesn't work for you. You can have sensitivities to certain ingredients when others don't. It's trial and error when it comes to skincare. Your best bet is to seek a dermatologist if many products aren't working in your favor. 

P.S. Makeup wipes are the worst. Don't do it.
faceoff_positive.headline: Works best as a pre-cleanse!

faceoff_negative.comments: I got a travel size version of this for free with a purchase, and it has that lever/spout type topâ€¦ which I hate because the oil gets all over the place no matter how careful you are. The way this smells is just so bizarre to me. I don't notice it too much if I just remove eye makeup, but if I remove anything by my nose or mouth it makes me want to gag. It's a lavender essential oil meets vinegar type smell to me. I also don't like that I have to use twice as many cotton rounds to remove my makeup with this stuff because it tends to smear the makeup around while it picks it up. The oil also stays on top of your skin, so even if you removed your makeup with anything else prior to using this, you'll still have to completely wash your face after this. Compared to the LancÃ´me Bi-Facial remover, this one is a flop for me. I will say though, a little does go a long way with this oil.
faceoff_negative.headline: I'd buy other makeup removers
